title: Dirichlet-Neumann learning algorithm for solving elliptic interface problems. (arXiv:2301.07361v2 [math.NA] UPDATED)
abstract: Non-overlapping domain decomposition methods are natural for solving interface problems arising from various disciplines, however, the numerical simulation requires technical analysis and is often available only with the use of high-quality grids, thereby impeding their use in more complicated situations. To remove the burden of mesh generation and to effectively tackle with the interface jump conditions, a novel mesh-free scheme, i.e., Dirichlet-Neumann learning algorithm, is proposed in this work to solve the benchmark elliptic interface problem with high-contrast coefficients as well as irregular interfaces. By resorting to the variational principle, we carry out a rigorous error analysis to evaluate the discrepancy caused by the boundary penalty treatment for each decomposed subproblem, which paves the way for realizing the Dirichlet-Neumann algorithm using neural network extension operators. translated_abstract: 非重叠区域分解方法在解决各种学科中出现的界面问题方面是自然的，然而，数值模拟需要技术分析，并且通常仅能使用高质量网格，从而阻碍了它们在更复杂情况下的使用。为了消除网格生成的负担并有效地处理界面跳跃条件，本文提出了一种新的无网格方案，即迪利克雷-诺伊曼学习算法，用于解决具有高对比度系数和不规则界面的基准椭圆界面问题。通过诉诸变分原理，我们进行了严格的误差分析，以评估每个分解子问题的边界惩罚处理造成的差异，为利用神经网络扩展算子实现迪利克雷-诺伊曼算法铺平了道路。我们实验证明了我们提出的方法的有效性和鲁棒性。
tldr: 提出了一种无网格方案——迪利克雷-诺伊曼学习算法，用于解决基准椭圆界面问题，能够有效处理界面跳跃条件，并通过误差分析为神经网络扩展算子实现迪利克雷-诺伊曼算法铺平了道路。
en_tdlr: A novel mesh-free scheme, the Dirichlet-Neumann learning algorithm, is proposed to effectively solve high-contrast coefficient and irregular interface benchmark elliptic interface problems, by removing the burden of mesh generation and effectively handling interface jump conditions. The proposed method is demonstrated to be effective and robust through experimental results, and its realization using neural network extension operators is paved by rigorous error analysis.
